title: cleaning_veg_data
text: Vegetation data QC critical step ecological data analysis. USDA plants database improves vegetation data quality, ensuring proper scientific names used, additional QC must performed. One primary tasks dealing identifications different taxonomic levels (.e., genus, species, subspecies). Statistical approaches think class separately therefore recognize similarity taxonomic levels. example, statistical analyses recognize relationship Pinus, Pinus contorta, Pinus contorta var. murrayana. reason, need determine modify data based characteristics data set expert knowledge. likely need done species--species basis. ultimate goal group observations one organism one class. example process code can use assist: begin , let’s use function identify possible conditions

title: QC vegplots — QC_vegplots_summary
text: QC_vegplots_summary() produces summary regarding completeness vegplots, including species richness plot percent species abundance data. information can used remove vegplots analyses due lack completeness. QC_vegplots_remove_plots() allows remove vegplots dataset based siteiids parameters related vegplot completeness.

title: QC vegplots — QC_vegplots_summary
code: QC_vegplots_summary(veg_df)  QC_vegplots_remove_plots(   veg_df = NULL,   my_QC_vegplots_summary = NULL,   min_species = NULL,   min_perc_species_with_abund = NULL,   min_perc_species_level_id = NULL,   siteiids = NULL )

title: QC vegplots — QC_vegplots_summary
text: veg_df veg_df created using ecositer::formatted_veg_df() my_QC_vegplots_summary results ecositer::my_QC_vegplots_summary() min_species site must >= N species included siteiids siteiids removed defined user min_abund sites must >= N% species abundance data included (e.g., entering 90 include sites 90% species abundance data). WARNING: keep sites missing abundance data intend run vegetation analyses using abundance data, abundance values populated. run analyses presence/absence data, abundance data needed.

title: QC vegplots — QC_vegplots_summary

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
text: big_beta_diversity calculates distance matrix using distance measure, big beta diversity.

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
code: big_beta_diversity(   veg_df,   wisconsin = FALSE,   remove_rare = FALSE,   relative_dist = TRUE )

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
text: veg_df properly formatted vegetation dataframe (formatted_veg_df). data QCed ensure meets minimum data requirements (QC_vegplots) remove_rare decimal value defining fraction sites species must present included (e.g., 0.01 means species must present > 1% plots). FALSE include species dataset. relative_dist relativized 0-1 dissimilarity values using: $$z_i = \frac{x_i - min(x)}{max(x) - min(x)}$$

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
text: distance matrix. distance matrix can used ordination determine similarity different ecological sites.

what: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
title: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
text: nmds_ecosite runs NMDS using vegan package. NMDS numerous settings can adjusted, can manipulated arguments function. function intended used quick way producing ordinations. interested optimizing NMDS, please research. minimum, understand stress evaluate stress report results.

title: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
code: nmds_ecosite(veg_summary, ecosite, pres_abs, nmds_dim, reduce_species)

title: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
text: veg_summary veg_summary object ecositer::veg_summary() function saved. ecosite ecosite ecosite(s) want include ordination. interested ordinating multiple ecosites together, concatenate ecosites interest (e.g., c("", "b")) pres_abs use TRUE convert data presence/absence. robust option. missing abundance values, presence/absence used. abundance data, use FALSE. nmds_dim specify number dimensions want NMDS. value affect stress considerably. reduce_species NA want remove species. numeric value, interpretted percent, specifying minimum percentage plots species must present remain dataset.

title: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
text: NMDS object generated using vegan package

title: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
code: formatted_veg <- formatted_veg_df(static_location = "C:/Users/Nathan.Roe/Documents/SEKI/CA792_veg.sqlite") #> Error: Local NASIS ODBC connection has not been set up. Please see `http://ncss-tech.github.io/AQP/soilDB/setup_local_nasis.html`. my_veg_summary <- ecositer::veg_summary(veg_df = formatted_veg) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'formatted_veg' not found my_nmds <- ecositer::nmds_ecosite(veg_summary = my_veg_summary, ecosite = "F022AK100CA", pres_abs = TRUE, nmds_dim = 2, reduce_species = NA) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'my_veg_summary' not found

[54 of 4847 horizons] #> mixing moist colors ... [102 of 5407 horizons] #> NOTE: some records are missing rock fragment volume #> NOTE: all records are missing artifact volume #> replacing missing lower horizon depths with top depth + 1cm ... [59 horizons] #> Warning: Horizon top depths contain NA! Check depth logic with aqp::checkHzDepthLogic() #> Warning: Horizon bottom depths contain NA! Check depth logic with aqp::checkHzDepthLogic() #> -> QC: sites without pedons:  #> 	Use `get('sites.missing.pedons', envir=get_soilDB_env())` for site record IDs (siteiid) #> -> QC: duplicate pedons:  #> 	Use `get('dup.pedon.ids', envir=get_soilDB_env())` for pedon record IDs (peiid) #> Warning: cannot set `phiid` as unique pedon horizon key - `NA` introduced by fill=TRUE #> -> QC: pedons missing bottom hz depths: #> 	Use `get('missing.bottom.depths', envir=get_soilDB_env())` for pedon record IDs (peiid) #> Joining with `by = join_by(ecosite_simple)` #> Joining with `by = join_by(ecosite_simple)` # specify user-defined location - # my_plots_by_site <- number_plots_by_site(static_location = "C:/Users/Nathan.Roe/Documents/SEKI/CA792_veg_data.sqlite") head(my_plots_by_site) #>     ecositeid ecosite_simple pedons vegplots numb_statephases #> 1        <NA>           <NA>    145     1042                1 #> 2 F022AD102CA           D102     67       35                4 #> 3 F022AH102CA           H102     59       26                4 #> 4 F022AD104CA           D104     53       33                2 #> 5 F022AH106CA           H106     38       25                2 #> 6 F022AH101CA           H101     35       19                4 #>                                 statephases #> 1                                        NA #> 2 D102.1.1, D102.1.1P, D102.1.2F, D102.1.3F #> 3 H102.1.4F, H102.1.1, H102.1.2F, H102.1.2A #> 4                       D104.1.1, D104.1.4F #> 5                       H106.1.1, H106.1.3F #> 6 H101.1.2F, H101.1.1, H101.1.3F, H101.1.4F
